content.question:
"Et nunc ille Paris, cum semiviro comitatu,

Maeonia mentum1 mitra crinemque madentem

subnexus,2 rapto potitur: nos munera templis

quippe tuis ferimus famamque fovemus inanem."

1mentum, -i, n.: chin

2subnecto, -ere, subnexus: fasten beneath, tie under

In the passage above, Iarbas expresses his disdain for Aeneas by comparing him to Paris. In a short essay, discuss how Iarbas' speech reflects his contempt for Aeneas' culture and also for his behavior. Refer specifically to the Latin to support your answer. Then, referring specifically to events in Books 7-12 of the Aeneid, discuss briefly why Aeneas could appropriately be compared to Paris at some point in those books.
